answers.answer: Atrial fibrillation increases the likelihood of stroke, particularly in older patients (> 74), and patients hypertension, diabetes, heart failure and prior stroke.  Usually patients with these risk factors are treated with warfarin or dabigatran and aspirin is used in the patients considered at lower risk for stroke.  Nonetheless, the decision as to which treatment is best is between an individual patient and his/her doctor, taking into consideration his/her bleeding risk.

question: is baby aspirin okay to take for a 90 year old woman who has had a few incidents of AFib but also has been hospitalized with bleeding from diverticulitis?
title: baby aspirin
